com.pump.graphics

Class ImageInstruction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.graphics.ImageInstruction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicInstruction, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.tree.TreeNode

    public class ImageInstruction
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphicInstruction, java.io.Serializable
    An instruction to draw an image. This instruction should be equivalent to calling this code:
    g = (Graphics2D)g.create();
    g.clip(clipping);
    g.setTransform(transform);
    g.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,opacity));
    g.drawImage(bi, destRect.x, destRect.y,
      destRect.x+destRect.width, destRect.y+destRect.height,
      sourceRect.x, sourceRect.y,
      sourceRect.x+sourceRect.width, sourceRect.y+sourceRect.height,
      null);
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                        float opacity)
        Creates a new ImageInstruction.
        Parameters:
        i - the image to draw.
        t - the transform to draw with.
        dest - the destination rectangle.
        src - the source rectangle.
        clip - the optional clipping.
        opacity - the opacity.

        Returns the clipping used to render this image.

      • getSourceRect

        public java.awt.Rectangle getSourceRect()
        The source rectangle. This is anchored at (0,0) and should not exceed the width/height of the original image.

      • getTransformedShape

        public java.awt.geom.Area getTransformedShape()
        This is the outline of the area that this instruction actually affects. This may return an empty area if the clipping and destination rect don't intersect.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the image that is rendered.

      • getResizedDestRect

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getResizedDestRect()
        This returns the destination rectangle that is resized so it should render the entire buffered image. That is: the entire buffered image should be stretched so (0,0) and (w,h) fit within the rectangle returned by this method. This eliminates the need for the sourceRect data, because it is now implied that the sourceRect is (0,0,w,h).

      • getSource

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        Description copied from interface: GraphicInstruction
        Returns a string for developers to recognize the source of this instruction. By default this returns a stack trace, but it may return "Unknown" if the GraphicsWriter debugging flag is false.
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface GraphicInstruction
